abstract: Lumber Liquidators announces it will pay $2.5 million to settle allegations made by California Air Resources Board that its products violated state's air safety standards; payment is not accompanied with any admission of wrongdoing.
lead_paragraph: The beleaguered flooring retailer Lumber Liquidators is paying $2.5 million to settle allegations that some of its products violated California’s air safety standards.

headline.main: Lumber Liquidators to Pay $2.5 Million to Settle Allegations
headline.print_headline: Lumber Liquidators to Settle Air Safety Allegations

snippet: The beleaguered flooring retailer Lumber Liquidators is paying $2.5 million to settle allegations that some of its products violated California’s air safety standards.
